place.name: MINTLYN
place.gazetteerText: MINTLYN, a parish in Freebridge-Lynn district, Norfolk; adjacent to the East Anglian railway, 2½ miles E by S of Kings. Lynn. Post town, Lynn. Acres, 1,100. Real property, £985. Pop., 46. Houses, 4. The property belongs to R. Bagge, Esq. The living is a donative, not in charge, in the diocese of Norwich. The church is in ruins. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
